p: Contagion generally refers to how infection spreads between the individuals in networks within an environment. The contagious dynamics can be thoroughly inspected utilizing mathematical models of contagious processes which can then be utilized to acquire exact proportions of anticipated predominance of infectious diseases. Many models do not capture the probabilistic nature of contagion, or the asymmetry intrinsic in traditional infectious diseases, where the infected state spreads through social contagion whereas the non-infected state does not ( Hill, 2010).
